epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.general_description: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives. Used for foundations, paths, slabs, and other construction applications.

concrete_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
concrete_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high-rise buildings, dams, roads, bridges, with high strength, durability, or special performance requirements.

product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation.
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging.

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)
databases_and_software.note_on_impact_categories: Some impact categories modelled separately based on generic processes.

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m3 of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible.

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered without packaging.

data_quality.assessment: Good or very good geographic and temporal representativeness
data_quality.background_data_timeliness: All data updated within 10 years as required by PCR 2019:14

installation.operational_control: Holcim does not have operational control over installation
installation.activities_included: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation site work and forms.

end_of_life.control: Holcim has no control over end-of-life fate

deconstruction.method: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

benefits_and_loads_beyond_system_boundar.use_of_recycled_aggregate: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_note: CO2 absorption by concrete (carbonation) not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results
carbon_emission_context.carbon_footprint_reporting: EPDs provide transparency on carbon footprint, energy consumption, and resource use

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes

additional_info.product_hazard_classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to Australian Code for Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail
additional_info.sustainability_strategy: Industry's first 2050 net-zero targets endorsed by Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi)
